body_html:
I see, it seems that avro-1.8.0 is no longer downloadable. Your best bet would be to update workspace.bzl with the compatible AVRO version - perhaps to http://www-us.apache.org/dist/avro/avro-1.8.1/cpp/avro-cpp-1.8.1.tar.gz (and update the checksum accordingly).

Please feel free to fix that up and send a pull request to the r0.11 branch if that works.

Thanks!
body_text:
I see, it seems that avro-1.8.0 is no longer downloadable. Your best bet would be to update workspace.bzl with the compatible AVRO version - perhaps to http://www-us.apache.org/dist/avro/avro-1.8.1/cpp/avro-cpp-1.8.1.tar.gz (and update the checksum accordingly).
Please feel free to fix that up and send a pull request to the r0.11 branch if that works.
Thanks!
body:
I see, it seems that `avro-1.8.0` is no longer downloadable. Your best bet would be to [update `workspace.bzl`](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.11/tensorflow/workspace.bzl#L204) with the compatible AVRO version - perhaps to http://www-us.apache.org/dist/avro/avro-1.8.1/cpp/avro-cpp-1.8.1.tar.gz (and update the checksum accordingly).

Please feel free to fix that up and send a pull request to the r0.11 branch if that works.

Thanks!
